meanings.definition: To strike or attack before an anticipated attack.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers decided to prestrike the enemy camp before dawn.
meanings.sent2: It is a good strategy to prestrike the opponent to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent3: The ninja prestrike the villain, catching him off guard.
meanings.sent4: The lion prestrike its prey, ensuring a successful hunt.
meanings.sent5: The detective prestrike the suspect, preventing a crime from happening.

meanings.definition: A strike or attack made before an anticipated attack.
meanings.sent1: The prestrike on the enemy base was a success.
meanings.sent2: The army planned a prestrike to weaken the enemy's defenses.
meanings.sent3: The surprise prestrike caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent4: The prestrike was like a lightning bolt in the dark night.
meanings.sent5: The prestrike was a crucial move in the battle strategy.
